Summary: Very close, blinking or rotating lights, hovered, sped off FAST & out of sight.

There were no other sightings in Pittsburgh on or around December 9th 1966
divs: sighting detailsi was driving my 9 passenger station wagon to north hills mall. my girlfriend,carolyn and her 2 kids 9 & 8 and my 3 kids 9,8,and 5 were topping a slight elevation on mcknight road heading s. to north hills mall. the hovering disk was in front of us as we got to the hilltop,about 1\2 mile from the mall. i said "wow" look at that! ohmygosh.it's a flying saucer "(or something to that effect) and pulled off to the side of the road. i had an adrenalin rush, was excited but there was a fear factor too. an incredibility trance, staring at it. but i felt safe with us all in the car, together. it looked exactly like 2 saucers ;one upside down, on top and one ,right-side up. it looked like there was a narrow band between the two with lights; either blinking or there was a rotation giving the illusion of blinking. the disk was black or charcoal in the night sky. it hovered. moving back and forth and back and forth and a slight up and down. it even moved slightly over mcknight road towards kaufman's (separate) store. we were speechless. pamela, carolyn's 9 year old got very upset and was crying "i'm scared. i'm scared" . i encouraged the kids to keep looking because it was something none of us would ever ever forget. it looked quite large over this smaller 1960's type mall, probably covering 1\4th of it. it was not high in the sky, looking to be about 400 yards over the mall. we watched it for about 20 seconds. carolyn told me 'let's get going, pam is upset". all of a sudden it took a slight swoop and then off in a slanted s.w. direction straight up into the sky and was gone! took off so fast and was not visable so fast it took our breath away. another car had pulled off the road behind us to watch this. we quieted the kids and proceeded to the mall.when i got home around 9 i told my husband about it. his brother, a priest from e. pa. was visiting as i told them both. i said i was going to call the t.v. news station. my husband was v.p. in a financial institution in a small town; and said he did not want any embarrasing notoriety with me calling some t.v. station and looking stupid. because #1 he didn't believe me, thought i was exaggerating or mis identifying what i had seen and #2 he did not want 'his family' to be 'made fun of' if my story hit the news. even though the kids told him the story they were too young for him to give them any credibility. i was anxious to watch the evening news but there was no mention of it.nothing??? i could not believe anything that big and visual in such a busy place as mcknight road before christmas would not have been seen and reported by someone. mcknight road was full of traffic. but --- it was 1967. there was nothing in the paper the next day either.?? i still cannot believe it was not reported. i am wondering if the car that pulled off the road behind us ever called anyone.? what were they thinking? over the years i have told the story occasionally. there is no way anyone can ever discredit or 'take away' what i saw. it was not one of those 'dancing, flashing lights way up in the sky that people have photographed and called a ufo . it was large, close, pulsating, and we could see details. it's 'exit' defies words. i have wanted to share this sighting for decades. thanks for giving me this opportunity. it is still very visable in my mind.
